intro: Lapathon sylvaticum, commonly known as the woodland lapathum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of woodlands and along stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with serrated edges, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Lapathon sylvaticum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
